Article 1: THE ARCHITECT'S SERVICES:- The Architect's professional services consist of taking the Minister's instructions, attending the necessary conferences, providing continuous supervision and inspection of the work, general administration of the work on behalf of the Minister, submitting reports showing progress of the work, the checking of Contractor's and other accounts, the checking and certifying of progress estimates submitted by the Contractor for payment by the Minister, and to be the liaison officer between the Minister or any of his representatives and the Contractor on the work.

Article 2: SUPERVISION OF THE WORK:- The Architect will protect the Minister against defects and deficiencies in the work of Contractors. The general supervision which the Architect will give to the work is such periodic inspection by him and continuous superintendence by his representative, hereinafter referred to as the Clerk-of-Works, as may be necessary to ensure that construction of the work is being carried out with the true intent of the contract and in accordance with the working drawings and specifications. Constant superintendence of the work forms part of the Architect's duties and is provided for in the Architect's fee and reimbursements.

Article 3: THE ARCHITECT'S FEE:- The fee payable by His Majesty to the Architect for the performance of the Architect's professional services is the percentage hereinbefore defined in this Agreement as the basic rate, computed upon the cost of the work in respect of which such services have been performed, subject however to any modifications arising under these Conditions of Agreement.

Article 4: DEFINITION OF THE COST OF THE WORK:- "Cost of the Work" means the total of the contract sums, and any additions thereto approved by the Minister, but does not include Architect's and Engineer's Fees, reimbursements to the Architect and equipment or furniture usually provided by the Department.

When labour or material is furnished by the Minister below its current market cost or should old materials be reused, the cost of the work is to be interpreted as the cost
of all materials and labour necessary to complete the work,
as such cost would have been if all materials had been new
and if all labour had been fully paid at market prices
current when the work was ordered.

Article 5: REIMBURSEMENTS:- The Minister will reimburse the
Architect for:-

(a) The costs of transportation and personal living expenses
incurred by the Architect and the Clerk-of-Works, while
travelling in discharge of duties solely connected with the
work. In case of mileage travelled for which convenient
railway or motor bus transportation is not available, an
allowance of eight cents ($0.08) per mile may be paid. The
mileage allowances paid cover the entire cost to the Govern-
ment except bridge tolls and ferry charges.

(b) The salary of a Clerk-of-Works engaged and paid by the
Architect, provided that the Minister shall have approved
of the engagement of such Clerk-of-Works as a necessity, and
shall have approved of the salary rate to be paid.

Article 6: SPECIAL CASES:- If the execution of the work, or any
part of the work be abandoned or suspended, the Architect
shall be paid at the basic rate in proportion to the service
rendered for such work or part thereof up to the time of such
abandonment or suspension.

Article 7: PAYMENTS:- Whether the work be executed or whether its
execution be suspended or abandoned, in whole or in part,
payments to the Architect on his fee are, subject to the
provisions of Article 6, to be made as follows:

From time to time during the execution of the work and
in proportion to the amounts approved for payment to the
Contractor certified by the Architect, payments shall be made
to the Architect until the aggregate of all payments made on
account of the fee referred to in this Article shall equal
the sum computed on the basic rate stated in this Agreement
with respect to the final cost of the work.

Payments to the Architect, other than those of his fee,
fall due from time to time as his work is done or as costs
are incurred or as he may in any way become entitled to such
payments.
No deduction shall be made from the Architect's fee on account of penalty, liquidated damages, or other sums withheld from payments to Contractors.

Article 8: PRELIMINARY ESTIMATES:- When requested to do so, the Architect will make or procure preliminary estimates on the cost of any part of, any additions to, or deductions from the work, and he will endeavour to keep the actual cost of such work as low as may be consistent with the purpose of the building and with proper workmanship and material.

Article 9: CLERK OF WORKS:- To provide constant superintendence of the work, over and above the general supervision provided by the Architect, a Clerk-of-works shall be employed and paid by the Architect.

Article 10: CONSTRUCTIONAL EMERGENCIES:- The Architect has authority to give such orders on behalf of the Minister as are necessitated in the Minister's interests by constructional emergencies.

Article 11: DEFAULT:- In case the Architect or his representative shall make default, or fail to carry out his duties in connection with the work, or otherwise in the opinion of the Minister fails to observe and perform any of the provisions of this Agreement, then and in any of such cases, the Minister, for and on behalf of His Majesty, and without any further authorization, may take all the work out of the Architect's hands, and in such case the Architect shall have no claim for any further payment on account of the basic rate or any reimbursement stipulated to be payable to the Architect in this Agreement, but shall be chargeable with, and shall remain liable for all loss and damage which may be suffered by His Majesty, occasioned by such default or delay.

Article 12: SUCCESSOR TO AGREEMENT:- The Architect shall have the right to join with him in the performance of this Agreement, any architect or architects with whom he may in good faith enter into relations of partnership. In case of the death or disability or retirement from partnership of one or more partners, the rights and duties of the Architect, if a firm, shall devolve upon the remaining partner or partners or upon such firm as may be established by him or them, and he, they or it shall be recognized as the "successor".
of the Architect, and so on, until the service covered by
the Agreement has been performed. The Architect shall not
assign, sublet, or transfer his interest in this Agreement
without the written consent of the Minister.

Article 13: INTERPRETATION OF TERMS:- The expression "His
Majesty" herein includes the successors and assigns of
His Majesty; the expression "the Minister" includes the
successors in office of the Minister of Citizenship and
Immigration; and the expression "the Architect" includes
the heirs, executors, administrators and assigns of the
Architect.
